system.description: Beginning at 2nd level, you may use your Channel Divinity to temporarily animate the body or a pile of bones of a creature you touch. Upon doing so, the undead mutters the name (if any) and the creature type (such as Giant or Humanoid - the GM may choose to be more specific, such as stating Orc, or Elf) of the creature that killed it. For the next 24 hours, you or a creature of your choosing gains advantage on the next ability check made regarding the creature (such as a History check to recall something about it, or a Survival check to track it) or attack roll made against it.
